Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the Applicant's misrepresentation material to her admissibility under subsection 40(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claim about son's parentage found false
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Misrepresentation of material fact regarding child’s parentage
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Whether misrepresentation induced or could induce error in administration of the Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: False claim led to admission as Canadian citizen without proper checks
Crimes.Application_Error: Son admitted as citizen based on false biological relationship
Crimes.Application_Factor: Claim that son was sponsor's biological child
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Inadmissibility upheld due to material misrepresentation
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Misrepresentation of parentage leading to improper citizenship grant
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: False documentation and statements regarding paternity
Crimes.Document_Fraud: False border/citizenship documents based on misrepresented parentage
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant lacked credibility due to false claims
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Citizenship Act
